texts.definition: Abstract or diegetic places where resources can be found or acquired.
markups: <style="Definition">Abstract or diegetic places where resources can be found or acquired.</style>

Resources are a typical component of games. <style="CurrentLink">Resource Sources</style> are places in game worlds or abstract repositories for resources that allow players to gather, manipulate, or otherwise access them through actions.

The place where fruits appear in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pac-Man">Pac-Man</link></style> is a <style="CurrentLink">Resource Source</style> to the degree that these fruits are resources. In many <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Roleplaying%20Games">Roleplaying Games</link></style>, both tabletop and computerized, killed enemies are <style="CurrentLink">Resource Sources</style> for experience points and various types of loot. The squares or hexes in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Civilization%20(video%20game)%20series">Civilization series</link></style> can contain resources that are either strategic (e.g. iron, coal, horses) or luxury (e.g. gold, spices, silk) in nature. Similarly, the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Starcraft%20series">Starcraft series</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Warcraft%20series">Warcraft series</link></style> have locations where resources can be harvested from the game world.

<style="CurrentLink">Resource Sources</style> provide players with ways of gaining <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style>. Examples of <style="CurrentLink">Resource Sources</style> include <style="Link"><link="pick-ups">Pick-Ups</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="resource-locations">Resource Locations</link></style>, and other players when <style="Link"><link="trading">Trading</link></style> with them is possible. <style="Link"><link="loot">Loot</link></style> provided from <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Inhabitants">Inhabitants</link></style>, or <style="Link"><link="non-player-characters">Non-Player Characters</link></style> are also typical <style="CurrentLink">Resource Sources</style>.

The presence of <style="CurrentLink">Resource Sources</style> in games encourage <style="Link"><link="stimulated-planning">Stimulated Planning</link></style> for players to the degree that they have need for those <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style>. They can also lead to <style="Link"><link="resource-management">Resource Management</link></style> if the sources can be manipulated, protected from other agents, or be created by the players themselves.
